You are given $n$ piles of stones with sizes $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$. You can merge two piles by adding the smaller pile's stones to the larger pile.  The cost of merging piles is equal to the size of the smaller pile.

Each pile has a limit $k$ on how many times it can be merged.  You are given $q$ different values for $k$.

For each value of $k$, find the minimum cost to merge all the stones into a single pile.

You have multiple piles of objects. You can merge two piles by adding the smaller pile to the larger one, costing the size of the smaller pile.  You are given multiple limits on how many times each pile can be merged. Find the minimum cost to merge all piles into one.
